extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, cut into pieces

recipes.title: Mini- Cherry Cheesecake Bites

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are my top picks for Cake. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line cupcake tins with 16-18 paper liners.2. In medium bowl, use an electric mixer to beat eggs with sugar. Add pieces of cream cheese a little at a time. Beat until smooth, about 5 minutes. Mix in vanilla extract.3. Place vanilla wafer in each paper cupcake liner. Fill 3/4 full with cream cheese mixture.4. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until cheesecake mixture is set.5. Cool completely. Remove cupcake liners and gently top with cherry pie filling.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line cupcake tins with 16-18 paper liners.2. In medium bowl, use an electric mixer to beat eggs with sugar.
Add pieces of cream cheese a little at a time. Beat until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Place vanilla wafer in each paper cupcake liner. Fill 3/4 full with cream cheese mixture.4.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until cheesecake mixture is set.5. Cool completely.
Remove cupcake liners and gently top with cherry pie filling.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.
